intro: Lettsomia tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly lettsomia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It is characterized by its dense, woolly coating on its stems and leaves, which helps it retain moisture in its high-altitude environment. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in cool, moist conditions and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
